website_summaries.verdict: This is the best Dot yet at the same irresistible price -- but it will do little to slow Google's growing momentum.
pros: The new Echo Dot looks and sounds better than ever, and now you can pair two together for stereo audio
The ongoing space race between Alexa and Google Assistant means it'll keep getting a steady stream of new features
Best of all: It's still just $50
cons: It doesn't come in any fun colors like the Home Mini does, and it doesn't feature any new hardware tricks, either
Aside from the new look and the stronger sound, it's just the same Dot as before

customer_reviews.title: Muffled
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Echo Dot gen 2. I am very disappointed. Alexa sounds distant and muffled. Music playback and the alarms sound normal. There is something wrong when she speaks and I have to turn the echo dot up. Only problem is, when the alarm goes off in the mornings it’s super loud. Wish they would add new volume settings is this is going to be the norm going forward. Also, very disappointed in Amazon customer service. I was supposed to have a call back yesterday morning between 8:30am-9:3am CST and it never happened. I will be requesting a replacement device and I’m leaving this bad review in part because of the failed customer service promise.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor H.

customer_reviews.title: Best Echo dot ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good smart speaker. It has way better sound than the previous version!
customer_reviews.author: LOOSE SCREWZZ &VIEWS

customer_reviews.title: Customer service for the echo dot is ridiculous!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I have had a few echo dots. 1st gen, few 3rd gens, never had one stop working. This latest stopped working within a month. And to replace it, they want you to send it back to wait to repair it and only if they can't repair it will they send you a new one. I don't know about everyone else but I don't want a "repaired" device that worked for less than a month. So silly how they''ll replace anything else except their own product!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: UNREAIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, one upstairs and one down. They were exceedingly difficult to hook up and are totaly unreiable, sometimes they work and the next second they will not. Even when they do work, the qulity of information is limited and inferior. The news reports do not change for many days. These have just been a frustrating horrible waste of money, do yourself a favor, pass these by until they can prefect them a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad distortion after playing for few minutes
customer_reviews.text: I own 1st generation Echo and Tap and decided to give this a try to use in other rooms. I was able to play from Amazon Music with no issue. However, there was a bad static after a few minutes of playing music. I reset it by unplugging it and plugging in back on and the distortion went away for a few minutes but came back again. Also paired it with my phone via bluetooth and played music from iTunes. Same problem, after few minutes, there was bad distortion.
customer_reviews.author: S. P.

customer_reviews.title: Speaks and responds clearly
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my Dots. I have them in 3 rooms. The range seems sometimes to be too close when I call out a command; however, when I am in a room and want to hear music I don't want to have to hear it from another room. Since I'm rating the speaker itself and not the Alexa App, I can only say it speaks clearly and plays music with good sound. It responds to my voice. Sometimes it doesn't understand me, even though it has supposedly learned my voice. It was easy to install. Found my WiFi with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: MissT

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Much improvement over the last gen in sound quality. I currently own 5 different echo devices and use the dot for the bathroom but the second gen was a little underwhelming during a shower. But, that is no longer an issue. Now if we can just get some decent 3rd party wall or socket mounts for this thing and I'll be set.
customer_reviews.author: michael alston

customer_reviews.title: Sounds better when it does.
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was going to write a higher review but I have had some issues with the New Dit. Unfortunately at times it sounds Very Fuzzy, like a Buzzing sound. This will be during any random song. Sometimes the Same song will sound fine. Other times it can just sound horrible and I just yell for Alexa to STOP because I can't stand that sound. Almost seems like the speakers are just messed up half the time. When it works, it sounds Way better than the Echo 2. When it gets fuzzy, it's just awful. Also, I paid $30 New and NOW they're charging $50. THAT Is why I also Can NOT give it more than 3☆.
customer_reviews.author: MommaT

customer_reviews.title: The sound just crackled at minimal volume!!!
customer_reviews.text: Update: customer service reached out to me about my issue. Tonight (Jan 20th, 2018) I noticed the speaker crackled and had trouble playing the songs "Lost Boys" and a few other songs at 30% volume. I was able to record and will post a video. I did get a great holiday deal on the speaker, however it appears the speaker might not even last a year if this is the quality it provides!!! This doesn't even seem worth the money if it can't play lullabies without distortion NOT at 100% volume...
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: WiFi no connects badly.
customer_reviews.text: Echo fail when attempting to connect to a WIFI that is commercial. My apartment complex provides Spectrum internet and cable free. Each apartment has a different log in. Been trying for a couple of days and researching. Thought I had it once or twice....Will call Spectrum, saved it for last on Monday. UPDATE 12/9/19 Spectrum was helpful with finding and now knowing how to add a device to the network. Problem still remains; either an Alexis or an iPhone7 issue. The AMZ network doesn't stay available to find and connect temporarily so I can get to full connectivity. Will proceed and see how much time I need to devote to this for some supposed ease???
customer_reviews.author: Charles H

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I got the echo dot and an amazon smart plug for free from Verizon, I shouldn’t have clicked on that link to get it, it was a mistake... I never knew that I would really enjoy having Alexa in my house. I ended up buying 2 more echo dots and 6 smart plugs and a 4K fire tv. As a prime member I have access to music and videos by amazon, I’m also a Apple Music and the echo dot intergrates it flawlessly. I have Netflix, Hulu and Disney plus and I hope that they integrate these services flawlessly. I did not expect to buy all these Alexa powered products from a “free” promotion. Well played amazon... well played.
customer_reviews.author: Quang Cao

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It takes 4 minutes to locate the Echo. Then it says to setup wifi manually, even tho my wifi works fine. Then when I select their amazon wifi it says it's connected and the light changes to red or pink and the app bails out to the start page. It does this over and over and never connects. Nice packing too, Th small Dot box was thrown in a 12x12x12 box with no packing and had a very rough ride. Pitiful.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Echo Dot for Amazon Music
customer_reviews.text: I have been enjoying the Amazon Music BUT the albums and selections I selected on Amazon Music do not always play upon my request and at times some music I do not like starts playing! Also, the one Echo Dot is all I have and I only want to subscribe to the $3.99/ month option and it will not let me!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: This doesn’t work with hotspot.
customer_reviews.text: I have been on amazon’s support page, I have called their support number, this is running the latest software, and this still doesn’t work. In the Q&A for this device, people say it works with hotspot, but it does not. Amazon’s support rep told me this was a, “known problem”. We were on the phone for 30min and got nowhere. At the end, she told me to try again in a few days... I wish this had been stated clearer from the beginning. It’s useless without internet. There’s no reason they couldn’t have build this to simply stream music from your phone via Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Great Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Of course, the setup was easy. Just plugged it in and it used my account information and set up with no added effort from me. It feels nice - the fabric outer shell. The response is fast, given the increased number of listening microphones. But the biggest difference for me between the 2nd generation and this 3rd is the sound. Huge improvement! And get this: IMHO the sound from the 3rd gen rivals the sound from the 1st gen Echo! I personally think it's better. I bought two for my workout room and paired them to play stereo. Very nice sound! I ended up grabbing a 3rd one for the bathroom!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Masseur

customer_reviews.title: Not intuitive
customer_reviews.text: If the device doesn't connect to a wireless router it's useless. I have a previous version of the Echo Dot which connected flawlessly. Wish I could say the same about this one. During set up it tries to connect to a secure network without even asking for the password. The result is that it can not connect. After trying multiple times to connect I contacted Amazone support. They could not get it to connect either. This 3rd gen is going back to Amazon, very disappointing. Any device should ask for a password when connecting to a secure network but this one does not.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Best money I spent all year.  Wow..just...wow.  A personal assistant for a few dollars!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Echo Dot!!! Set it up and playing music all afternoon. Love classical and opera. So soothing. Like have a room mate without all the downsides. Staying home, staying safe gets a bit lonely. This little device is worth it's weight in gold to chase away the blues. I bought two Echo Dots..one for my living room and one for my art studio. I am looking forward painting with classical music in the background. And listening to the news in the morning. Making grocery lists. Calendaring appointments. This is my personal assistant. Buy one, two or more. You control what you want to hear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why Aren't There Many Ways to Ask the Same Question to Obtain a Request.
customer_reviews.text: Were the programmers on substances dreaming this up? I ask to a piece of music on my Amazon Music account and she gives me three radio choices, I ask her to play a playlist and she starts playing music not on that playlist. I just now had to tell her to stop three times, the last I had to shout. There is pretty much only one way to do anything and we are required to learn each different way for our desired result. This is a failed product. The website leaves you half way through the process sometimes, and the links often appear to go to the wrong place.
customer_reviews.author: Octavemode

customer_reviews.title: So dispapointed withe these
customer_reviews.text: I am starting a FB live streaming for costume jewelry and need one for music that I could connect to my iPhone. Set up took forever, could never find the Bluetooth. I to get out of Alexa setup and to my settings to connect it. Every day I would fo to use it have to set it up all over again could it would say it found the Bluetooth but not pay. I bought two of them both were the same sucked! I found a Tribit great price, Got it out of the box, took all of two minutes to set most reading how lol. It connects no issues and can even talk on my phone with this great sound
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cummings

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: I love and hate this thing. I hate it because I got smart lights and it is annoying to say "alexa turn on bedroom" 3 times to get them to turn on. 1st time it doesn't hear me and the 2nd it doesn't understand me. I don't want to yell for this thing to work. I think its nice when it does work. I also don't like how if you ask a question it says "I don't know that one" I feel like the Google homes would know the questions because of having Google installed in it. Speaker quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Flores

customer_reviews.title: Why should I stay with Echo?
customer_reviews.text: We have enjoyed all of our Echo devices- 2 Dots & a Spot. It has been wonderful to be able to play Amazon Music on these devices with out ads. With the removal of Amazon Music I am considering going with Google Home. Google works with my Hue Lights and can do everything Alexa does & more. Why should I continue with Echo devices- that doesn't have its own Music and can't answer 2/3 of the questions my "Ok Google" on my phone can? (And it's not eligible for return. )
customer_reviews.author: Annie-

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE TEENS!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is ridiculous. It's all over the web how parents bought this for their teenagers only to find out they can't use them. Amazon does not allow teen accounts/profiles to access these devices. That means you would have to use your account to register them giving them full access to buying because the echo thinks it's yours. It also means no music custumization. For as advanced as a company as Amazon is, this is a MAJOR shortcoming that needs to be resolved. It should not be difficult to allow teen accounts to have their own echo with the same limitations as the apps on their phones.
customer_reviews.author: gmbonafilia

customer_reviews.title: Must have, PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, you have Amazon, you need Alexa. So many uses for these. You can use these for anything from checking the time to controlling everything in your home to listening to music to arming your home security system and MUCH, MUCH MORE. You can set your level of trust with this device and tailor settings to your tastes and needs. Sound quality is pretty good and functionality is AMAZING. Once you buy one and start using it you will find yourself buying 2,3,4 more. We have one in almost every room in our house and one in the garage. These are the potato chips of the electronics world... One is NEVER enough!
customer_reviews.author: PaSoccerDad

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: The gen 3 has really improved from the gen 2. Very nice piece. I really like the fact that you can use it to detect glass breaking and/or smoke detectors going off inside your home. It will send you a sound clip to your phone which you can then "drop in" and listen directly too. This is a fantastic feature, especially with pets at home. Has some good weight too it. Much heavier than gen 2. I feel the speakers inside are much better. Also looks much better than the gen 2.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t pair well, don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for my 87 year old mother for each part of the house. She has trouble with lamps, the remote, won’t use a life alert. I thought this to be a perfect solution. My mistake. I’m very technically savvy but this was a nightmare. Sitting next to it, Alexa can’t hear her. Spent almost 2 hours on the phone with support because it would not pick up the fire tv, they were useless. The only thing this is good for is turning the lamps off and on, I could have gone with another cheaper option just to do that. Waste of money, don’t buy it. Customer support was horrible and they gave no clue about their own products.
customer_reviews.author: FT Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Fun times
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun device. Alexa is always ready with a quick quip or a short story. She is also very good about playing the music I want to listen to. There are many songs that I like to play on my ukulele, and if I don't know the correct tune then Alexa will play it for me until I get it right. She is amazingly patient. She also does good weather for the local area and answers multiple questions as a go about my day. Things like how many teaspoons in a tablespoon, or how man grams in 8.5 ounces, or what the the square root of 262.3. She's almost like a very smart family member. She's humble too.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Vineyard

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Amazon customer service!
customer_reviews.text: After some thought I opted on buying the echo instead of the google device. I should have not done that. I have been trying to import my contacts for two days. I requested multiple verification codes and received none. I have an iPhone 8 so my phone is not the issue. So I tried contacting customer service via the “call me now” service. After the usual generic troubleshooting instructions the system prompts you to press “1” for customer service. Well...I pressed “1” about a million times and I was prompted to press “1” each time! At the end they hanged up on me. This happened 3 times. I’m returning this and getting google.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: 3 month warranty only on these devices
customer_reviews.text: So we purchased a echo dot gen 3 over the holiday sale, received it in December of 2018. In May of 2019 we heard a slight vibration in the speaker like it was blown. A month later it's rattles like a pop can at volumes over lever 4. Contacted Amazon customer service and the said the device only has a three month warranty and the best they could do was offer a 15% discount on a new device. We enjoy the echo products and have multiple throughout the house, and they are used to control our lights. Just keep in mind the warranty isn't worth 💩.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: I mean, why wouldn’t this hold even the slightest charge when it is unplugged??? Such a weird thing. I guess no battery allows it to be so cheap, but man. It’s an echo. Nothing truly exciting about it, other than a sense of convenience. Sound quality isn’t the best, it doesn’t pick up WiFi as strong as other electronics in the same place do. Also, I feel like I’m fighting to get Alexa to understand what I mean, even if I use exact commands. Whatever. It’s an echo and I got it for free, so I guess it lives it’s purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Sounds worse than the 2nd gen
customer_reviews.text: If I want better music I would get the full size one. This is a terrible update. Less crisp and really kill the clarity of the speech audio. I wouldn’t buy a dot for music and you really made the audio crappier where I have to make it overly loud to listen to the news briefings and such to get pass the voices now sounding like they are all muffled instead of being crisp and even tinny by those overly critical and wanting everything in a full size echo to be in a dot.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. O

customer_reviews.title: Smart speaker and more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily as a smart speaker - not for all the integration with lights and locks, etc. I am using it basically, as a speaker and alarm clock. I love it. While Alexa does not always understand me, I am learning. Her voice is non-obtrusive. She occasionally asks me things, only when I have just asked her to do soemeting - usually it is helpful. I was worried it would be buzzing or beeping or speaking to me without me speaking first and it doesn't. Good sound, too, for sure. For the price, totally worth it, even if you only use it as a speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R.

customer_reviews.title: Alexa -- My Guard Dog!
customer_reviews.text: Alexa is posted strategically around the house via these devices listening for glass breakage and smoke/carbon monoxide alarms! The Guard skill takes seconds to set up, and Alexa sends a text if your window gets broken. Also, Burglar Deterrent makes your house sound occupied while you're away, and you can choose any room sounds you think will get the job done. Kitchen, office, bathroom, you pick, Alexa plays. Alexa maintains lists, sets alarms and timers, answers basic questions, and can set off whatever you have plugged into a smart timer either by command or set to a routine. If you also have a camera which sends you alerts, this is pretty good security for not too much cash.
customer_reviews.author: LoveThatRonWhite

customer_reviews.title: The teenager loved it...
customer_reviews.text: It works just as you would expect, and it's quite entertaining when you ask it random questions. The ONLY reason I gave it 4 stars is because you must have an adult/parent Amazon account to set it up. Since we gave this as a gift to our "honorary" daughter (who's 13-1/2), and her mom doesn't have an Amazon account, we had to add her to our Amazon account. While I understand the reasoning for this limitation, a buyer should be aware that this could cause a problem. However, I still HIGHLY RECOMMEND it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Brock

customer_reviews.title: Not what it's all cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I'd love this but I don't. First off, this is my second Alexa or better yet a replacement for the first one I purchased because everything I tried to listen to or play on it kept stopping or disconnecting...ALL THE TIME!!! Nothing played for more than 10 minutes before it would cut out. Now they sent me a replacement and this one won't even go through the setup process or connect properly. I'm just over it. I'm going back to my Google home mini. Plus, isn't it supposed to digitally display the time?? Well mine doesn't. Not the first one and not this replacement. Smh
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Only good as an alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: The whole Alexa product is worthless, it cannot answer most of the questions that I ask it, When I ask Google I get an immediate answer. Unfortunately too late to return it. ******DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY*****
customer_reviews.author: JoeWilly

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE - BROKE IN 4 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: I have several echo dots. One disconnects from the wifi daily - it is 4 months old so just beyond the crappy 90-day warranty. I called customer service and they provided zero help beyond the standard scripted response of resetting the device (which works every time. . . but for a few hours only). I didn't realize the warranty was only for 3 months. You get what you pay for with these tiny little devices and SHAME ON AMAZON for not providing better support. 90 days??? Really???? I love my dots but be prepared for them to rapidly break. Perhaps Amazon did this by design to force the customer to continually spend money on electronics designed to fail. :( SMH
customer_reviews.author: Leona Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: This device is a great addition to my home...
customer_reviews.text: The bass resonance of Alexa's voice does vibrate the device from time to time so I have hooked it into my house speaker system. Many of the other functions I've used it for contain far less bass so it can be used as a standalone device. Response time is excellent and I'm still exploring new skills. After ordering the adapter I have successfully integrated with my Insteon smarthome setup. Basically this means I can control lights, the thermostat, etc. I've even been able to pair it with my "driveway alert" system so it lets me know when someone has pulled in my driveway or walked up my front door path. Useful to know when the mailman has arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E Shoesmith

customer_reviews.title: It was free so.....
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't have bought it myself but it was a gift when switching my insurance. It talks about being able to connect to bluetooth devices but that's only if they are Amazon related. So if you're thinking that you can connect any of your bluetooth capable devices to it, like a music player or speaker (unless it's an additional Amazon speaker) you're going to be disappointed. The sound was decent but even at its loudest it's not very loud and the voice recognition is good.
customer_reviews.author: B. L. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: Ok now that I have had it a few days I can honestly say what have I done with out you Alexa , I connected her to my smart tv and speaker unfortunately u can’t use it to change apps bummer. I like all the colors it glows . Green Means amazon package coming . Purple means u screwed up Orange means ready to set up It’s a great device When u can ask it a question ! I wish I could change her voice to male If u have a vizio smart tv it won’t change ur apps but will turn on off ! And connect to smart speaker Voice recognition is excellent Sound quality is good
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Alexa, What more can you say awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Ever since Alexa became available I was hurt. About the first generation dot, actually I bought several and scatter them throughout the house. She makes life very convenient. When the third generation came out although my first generation dots we’re still working hard and strong the speaker quality on the third generation Alexa’s was much better so I replaced several throughout the house because I use my Amazon music subscription to call out for any song I want to hear at any given time of day and I can hear good quality music throughout the entire house and have control of every Wi-Fi Enable to product in the house from anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: James Hysmith

customer_reviews.title: Plum Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: I waited until now to purchase the dot based on appearance and reviews. We purchased plum and within a week have received our second one. The versatility of asking Alexa to play music is what we like the most. Enabling other functions has been less important, though our daughter has added many. The sound quality is decent, not great but not bad. Being able to use the app when I am away to annoy/announce to those at home is awesome. We also purchased echo connect which works with our home phone to enable basically what amounts to speaker phone in every room. Overall glad we waited, I look forward to other editions and what else they come up with next.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hunter Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these in a deal with Amazon Prime + Amazon Music. I like a lot this speaker, I had the Google Home Mini before, and they're almost equivalent, but I think the dot has more tools under its belt. Pros: - High volume - Good audio quality - Integration with Alexa is amazing - The Drop In is perfect for a large house or apartment Cons: - The initial setup can be tricky if you're not tech-savvy - A little bigger than the competition - I wish there was more audio EQ options already built-in
customer_reviews.author: Daniel White

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement in construction and audio
customer_reviews.text: Connects just as easily as the 2nd gen dots and easy add to the app. Physically almost twice as heavy which helps it to feel more solid previous models. Last thing....the sound! Can honestly say it as good as google devices. So impressed I’m going to start replacing all the other dots in the house. I tried attaching a video but amazon didn’t like the iPhone video for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Vespa Momma

customer_reviews.title: Amazing audio capabilities
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this echo dot speaker. I have two older versions and this one is a huge upgrade. The speaker on it has amazing volume and real base. Plus now it automatically connects to everywhere when I play music. No fighting with skills. A new feature I have enabled allows them to basically all act like intercoms throughout the house too. My absolute favorite feature is playing my audio books on all of them at once. I can roam the house and they are all perfectly in sync. I wish I had bought two more on prime day! I didn't expect it to have such amazing audio capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: TheHappylittlelady

customer_reviews.title: 3 months in and now it’s useless
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for just over 3 months (ordered mid June). Now I can’t keep it connected and I’m outside the return window. I’ve tried all the reset suggestions and still no luck. I left it unplugged all weekend (Friday morning until Monday morning). Went through set up again. Got it to play half of a song and it’s having “a hard time understanding”. Changed it from our 5g to lower internet (less things are on it) and asked to play music again. I got the “confirmation” Reply, but no music started. Now it lights up as I say Alexa, but won’t do anything else. I am so frustrated!! I loved having it up until it stopped working
customer_reviews.author: taks

customer_reviews.title: Better than you'd expect in almost every way
customer_reviews.text: Setup was an absolute breeze - certainly MUCH easier than the struggle I had with a Google Nest Mini. The puck itself is nicely made, finished in an attractive fabric and with a pleasing heft. Physically disabling the microphone is simple for the sake of privacy. Alexa recognition works well for both my wife and me, and the sound quality of the built in speaker is surprisingly good - my wife uses it mainly to listen to SiriusXM for which it's pretty darn good. Based on our success with this we've added more Echo devices, integrating them with our Sonos speaker for example - it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Does not sync with Headspace
customer_reviews.text: I bought this - my first Amazon Alexa gadget - for the sole purpose of listening to Headspace sleep meditations without having my phone in my bedroom. Even though I linked the accounts, Alexa does not play any of the meditations from the app. I’ve tried to figure out other ways to use this thing, but the voice recognition is so bad that half the things I say to Alexa is wrong get wrong answers and just end up being annoying. I even tried replacing my bedside white noise machine with the echo but it keeps playing music with apps which of course is disruptive. Does anyone have a good reason to keep this thing that I’m missing ?
customer_reviews.author: Emily Miller

customer_reviews.title: Try it, you won"t be disappointed, we love ours!!! :-)
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon Echo Dot 3rd Gen is an amazing device! I had mine set up in less than 5 minutes using my cell phone and I am definitely not very knowledgeable about electronic devices. The sound quality is excellent and my husband, who is a musician was,totally blown away!!! We now have 3 echos. And music through the whole house. We sent one to my daughter who is physically disabled and she uses hers for everything including making phone calls,,setting an alarm and setting a timer [she's teaching us how to do even more with our Echos] If you have been considering the echo don"t hesitate, get one, the price is excellent and you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Pines Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Buy It Up
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little device, with big sound capacity. This may be to act as a buffer, but I notice the sound quality degrading depending on the surface the device is on (carpet, counter). Other Bluetooth devices don’t have a fabric sound buffer, I’m wondering if that impacts Alexa’s capacity to understand a command. Sound is more brash without the buffer, maybe Amazon can use a different material and reduce the thickness of the fabric buffer. Overall this is a great buy. I would suggest this size because the bigger the tower doesn’t mean the better quality. This is more portable than the tower.
customer_reviews.author: MamiS

customer_reviews.title: Buy now!
customer_reviews.text: I love it so much I bought another one! It recognizes my voice from other rooms. It's nice to be able to ask the time/weather/etc when I'm busy. The unit is small and unobtrusive. The sandstone one blends in nicely with any decor. The sound is great; has some nice bass. ( We have a small Bose and the sound is as good if not better.) The dots are set up to play music individually, or collectively. I'm saving my pennies to get some smart plugs to further integrate our home to the dot's program. We have one plug already; it turns the light off/on when we ask. Can't wait to learn more about it!
customer_reviews.author: tlgf1968

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: Voice recognition technology not yet a defined art. Admittedly, I am an Alexa-novice but find difficulty in getting concise answers to carefully framed questions beyond the time and predicted weather. Also have some security concerns with the technology in general but not with Alexa-specific. In the short time since I've purchased the Alexa module, I have more questions than answers. Not interested in reviewing reams of printed instruction for a device that should be intuitive. Alexa and Siri are early in their evolution but have promising futures for all things technological. Interestingly , her knowledge of differential calculus is impressive. Wish I had her 50 years ago in deference and reverence to my slide-rule. (Pre-Calculator Era)
customer_reviews.author: ArchitectOne

customer_reviews.title: A Great Improvement
customer_reviews.text: The sound is a great improvement over the version 2. I am not someone who is particularly picky about sound quality and was quite satisfied with the sound quality of the Dot 2. I have one Echo and sevaral Dots - one in every room. When the Dot 3 price dropped to $22 i thought i'd try it just to see the difference. And what a difference it is. The sound is a notable improvement - louder, purer, more mellow. Besides being radio, clock, alarm, weather thermometer, and information source, Alexa controls a living room light, porch light, grow lamps for indoor plants, and home thermostat. Alexa has become an indispensible part of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Free Man

customer_reviews.title: Still not ready for Prime Time.
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple echo dots. I love the functionality when they work. I control lights, timers, garage doors, and thermostat; however, they have a hard time hearing my wife and me. Old ones worked better for hearing commands. Many times, the closest one doesn't hear me, but the other room echo will respond. That's horrible. Even simple commands she gets wrong, when she finally does respond to me. I have a scenario called "activate" which turns on my cpap, light, and charger. Half the time when I say "activate", she gives me today's date. Amazon, please fix this issue. Make us heard. You are listening all the time, just answer me instead of responding randomly to my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Stoked-On-Spokes

customer_reviews.title: Speaker improvement
customer_reviews.text: The speaker in this 3rd gen Echo Dot seems better than in my 2nd gen Echo dot which is a good thing because it often loses bluetooth connection with my Bose Soundlink Color Speaker. Almost never a problem with my 2nd gen Dot. The Bose announces it is connected but the Dot says it is having trouble connecting (even now) and on the app it is searching constantly. So if I don't want to hear my expensive Amazon music through my Bose speaker, then it is okay. We have several Echos, Towers and Dots, and smart plugs throughout the house so I am not new to this game. For the sale price I paid, it is just okay.
customer_reviews.author: mec

customer_reviews.title: Alexa!?
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy that I got the deal for the Echo Dot. It's very cool that this is my hub that controls the smart plugs and music. I've used it for sleep timers with white noise, wake up alarms, kitchen timers, etc. I can also play channels from SiriusXM. It was great when #PassTheMic was going on. I believe that there's more that Alexa and the Echo Dot can do but I haven't looked into those features yet. You can also use the Alexa app to make adjustments to the Echo Dot such as the music selection from Amazon Music and volume control. The charcoal color is great as it blends in with my laptop that very similar in color.
customer_reviews.author: ChaChaCha

customer_reviews.title: sound quality is better than Google mini (1st gen) but cannot connect with Sengled bulb well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bundle-echo dot and sengled blub on black Friday hoping my first experience with this smart speaker would work perfectly. However, after trying and failing many times with the sengled bulb, I am not sure what the problem is, either Alexa or the smart bulb. I called the customer service and got the replacement on the echo, not with the bulb. The agent told me I will receive another bundle (echo and the blub) so I may be able to resolve the problem. Well, the problem is still there. Update-Called Amazon customer service about the continual bulb problem( bad connection with iPhone) and received the replacement for the smart bulb. Problem solved! Thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: antipas

customer_reviews.title: This junk is barely One step above their echo which is complete trash.
customer_reviews.text: This junk is barely One step above their echo which is complete trash. I bought several of these and The echos to put in my home and give as gifts. I'm so embarrassed to have ever given someone something like this. Constantly dropping connection! I do tech support for a living and nothing is going to help this. Useless for alarms or anything requiring consistent connection. So bad I have to go into my Alexa app every day just so I know which oned I have to go power cycle.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Alexa sucks at searching.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like it pretty well, It's in my bedroom so I'm the main users but my daughters use it to set appointment reminders and make lists. It has some interesting little skills you can download, I like trivia and random facts and it's good for that. reminders, notes,etc are ok If you're expecting google like voice search you'll be sadly disappointed, Alexa isn't good at searching, at all. It also doesn't work with my smart TV. (a three year old Samsung) If Alexa could be used as a voice search engine I'd most likely give it 5 stars. For right around 25 bucks though it;s handy for basic questions, weather, and of course music.
customer_reviews.author: softcell72

customer_reviews.title: As always Meet my Expectation
customer_reviews.text: I know several people who had have had the echo dot and I ALWAYS loved it. Finally amazon was running a special .99 cent for one if you sign up for prime which was a free month trial! Heck yeah! It came In 2 days nicely boxed and it was easy to set up and install and my life has been awesome ever since! I set all my alarms, listen to meditation or other music while cleaning, I can get the weather hands free and SO much other stuff. I love the drop in feature. When my husband is asleep the echo is loud enough to wake him up haha. 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Williams

customer_reviews.title: Music sync and guard circling ring will not work
customer_reviews.text: 1)delivered a day early, incredible 2)sound quality outstanding 3)would not connect with my selected echo, no music share 4)Amazon service excellent, chat,email telephone all reachable 5)i the light ring that circles when on Guard mode, does not function 6)Amazon offered to replace, I am not going there, too much time wasting in copious attempts to correct.
customer_reviews.author: milehi

customer_reviews.title: Do you Spanish?
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I love Alexa! I love this device and I love being able to just forget about the lights and about setting up alarms! It is tricky to shut her up and being late for work though... haha but I really enjoy what it is able to do! I know that I speak to fast and something I don't enunciate well... but I get sometimes a bit frustrated it because she doesn't understand me XD and the Spanish part still needs to be worked on. Besides that, with a good internet connection, this will change your life!
customer_reviews.author: Inkish Kingdoms

customer_reviews.title: Get more than one!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, why did I hold out for so long?! This little guy is amazing. We bought 2 at first and quickly realized we wanted one in every room so now we have 5. Thinking about getting 2 more for the bathrooms, lol. Obviously the Alexa function is pretty cool. But it's actually a really good music speaker. It's even better if you can play your music on multiple speakers at the same time for a more surround sound experience. I'm thinking about adding a subwoofer which would make it amazing. but by far our favorite feature is the ability to drop in on other rooms make announcements and make phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: You need it.
customer_reviews.text: Got it a few days ago. Highly recommend. I use timers a lot. When the timer goes off, you can tell it to turn off. Setting up is easy. Routines are wonderful. Alexa, goodnight. All the lights turn off, DND is turned on, Alexa says goodnight then turns on white noise sleep sounds. Everything gets customized in the Alexa app. If you’re unsure about an echo dot, poke around on the app. It’s wonderful, I wish I got it years ago. Obviously it isn’t perfect and your argue with Alexa sometimes. You just have to learn the correct phrases. I just wish there was a better user manual. The manual is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Her ears don't work so well
customer_reviews.text: She's not as smart as I thought she'd be. I do love the podcast feature, there hasn't been a podcast yet that she doesn't have on her rotation. I do wish though that you could play a certain episode, in haven't figured out how to do that yet. She's a little hard of hearing and every once in awhile she just starts talking out of nowhere, it's strange. She doesn't hear me well though and often plays the wrong podcast. I'll have to tell her several different times in order for her to play the correct one. She'll whisper sweet nothings to you if you're lonely so that's cool. 😉 All in all I liked having her around
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Who says old dogs can’t learn new tricks! Give it a try....
customer_reviews.text: Fun, useful, easy set up! Even for a beginner, or let’s say late bloomer (65) ..came with our Ring security system. Never thought I’d use it, but very handy. With less than stellar memory, this Is a huge help. Thanks for including this, Amazon, greatly appreciated...finding new uses, every day, Alexa is a new family member...but still won’t fold laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Caribouwoman

customer_reviews.title: Works well...but plug in, no USB. Liked Gen 2 better!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I don't use my Echo to listen to music. I have some Yamaha's for that. This "new" dot need 15w and a PLUG. It doesn't sue USB so I can't plug it in where my others dots are (ie USb distribution at computer desk, USB charger on the coffee table, USB at Craft desk). I'd rather have more Mics and less speaker,...and USB powered. I mostly use thew Echo to turn lights on and off, and control my environment. I have a weird muscle disease, and occasionally have difficulty moving....and even paralysis. Voice is the last to go...so I do LOVE the DOTS, (7 of them). Just my personal preference. (FYI: Ask My Buddy...works)
customer_reviews.author: glmccready

customer_reviews.title: Love My Echo Dots
customer_reviews.text: I was wary at first about purchasing any Amazon devices. I'm glad I finally bit the bullet! These are handy little devices to have around the house. We can communicate in different rooms without having to yell at each other and I play music on mine while I work in my home office. I have my Ring doorbell connected to my Amazon account so I even get a notification on my Echo Dot when someone is at the door. Give the Echo Dot a try if you want to see what all the hype is about.
customer_reviews.author: Cornboy98

customer_reviews.title: Use The Link Account Option When Purchasing This......
customer_reviews.text: ......it will make the set up a breeze. In the older generations of Dots, it had issues for me when setting them up. This new generation with the linking to one's account option at purchase, takes away the potential nightmares of getting your network to recognize it. All I had to do was plug it in, go into the Alexa app, making sure Bluetooth was on in my tablet, confirm the light ring was orange on top of the Dot and I was done connecting to it. In the app I selected it and modified the settings to my likes. Nice and easy. Having existing Echo devices on my network made this a slam dunk.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Rice

customer_reviews.title: Good at the promotional price
customer_reviews.text: For the 10$ promotional cost (1$ + 1 month amazon premium music) it is a 5 star device. I wouldn’t pay the full price for it. However, I don’t have a “smart” home, so I can’t tell it to do anything. It is nice to have it connected to my home stereo so I can stream music, and it will also relay Bluetooth to another Bluetooth device. Sound quality is like any cheap speaker. No deep bass, so stereo seperation, and it’s not high fidelity. Streaming is also not super hi fidelity - mp3 320kb quality is what it sounds like. I don’t think it plays Spotify back in high quality mode like the Spotify app does.
customer_reviews.author: Metz

customer_reviews.title: Overall love it but....
customer_reviews.text: I have had my 2 Echo dots for 4 months. There can still be 'communication' issues. If I ask for a certain Pandora station Alexa plays a different station. This has happened repeatedly. When I first received mine Amazon had great customer service and I was able to reach customer service, not anymore. I have moved and one of my units will not connect with my Wi-fi. I have contacted Amazon through the app but have not received an answer. For the price, yes it is worth it to listen to muxic but don't expect consistency. Communication is a problem Amazon needs to work on with these units.
customer_reviews.author: tsouth

customer_reviews.title: Great Updated Echo
customer_reviews.text: Amazon was running a really good deal on the Echo Dot, so I decided to purchase another one for our home. We have one of the original ones from a few years ago, but now we could have one upstairs and downstairs, so we didn't have to shout. I love the look of this newer version of the Dot. It's so much more visually appealing than our original one, so it took center stage in the living room. The sound quality is amazing different and better, too. It's more (ironically) "echo-ey" and sounds like it's the difference between being in stereo and monotone. It's a welcome addition to our Echo family.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K.

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I’m still figuring out if these things are worth anything at all. About all I do with them (yes I have 4) is note that I have packages from Amazon! Which is annoying. Seeing that flashing yellow ring and asking “what are my notifications “ when I already know what they are is useless and annoying. Truthfully I can’t find a use for these things, yet. And the “yet” is the thing. Aren’t we supposed to have automated homes by now? I have a Ring doorbell, Roomba vacuums, and many other “smart” devices but I can’t seem to get the voice activation crap work. Maybe in 10-20 years, but this crap doesn’t work now.
customer_reviews.author: bobmac

customer_reviews.title: Layered Product that could continually cost you money
customer_reviews.text: I initially got the alexa puck with my blink camera system. I've never been excited or have desired to put such an intrusive and privacy-violating device into my house. (Then again, I have Win10 so what the hell, right?) Anyway, my biggest complaint with the puck is that, even with my prime account, I still have to pay for services like Amazon music if I want to hear what I want to hear. Without the puck playing background noise, it's pretty much useless for me and just sits there, most of the time, muted, consuming electricity. I still don't get it. Meh. Pointless little dongle.
customer_reviews.author: Emopausal

customer_reviews.title: Alexa won me over from Google.
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate Alexa’s ability to learn and recognize my voice. Echo dot responds to what I consider “natural commands” like when listening to Audible I can tell Alexa “pause” and Alexa “resume” and Echo works perfectly. Full disclosure too: I have a Google Nest at home, and a Google Hub too, and the Echo dot outperforms it and seems like I should have purchased it instead of my Googles. I use my Echo at work to listen to SiriusXM and Audible books, it pauses and resumes easily so phone calls and clients don’t have to listen to my background music or books. Will probably get another Echo.
customer_reviews.author: islandmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition
customer_reviews.text: Two years ago I said I'd never allow one of these devices into my home. My son sent me one as a birthday gift and it took me 6 months before I even attempted to take it out of the box. My new Echo Spot is my personal third device, and I'm thinking of adding at least two more! I'm still leery about the privacy invasion, but so far, so good. Love the tone and the ease of getting it to play some really great musical selections. By the time I get around to really investigating more of the available Skills the technology will be in full hologram mode, but I'll get there eventually :-)
customer_reviews.author: Gemini LMW

customer_reviews.title: Not always reliable, but still really helpful
customer_reviews.text: These are overall decent devices. They're small, sleek, and have amazing soung quality for such small speakers. I love the household settings, the reminders, and the skill blueprints. The only issues i've had are setting them up (it couldn't set up without a wifi connection, but couldn't connect wifi without being set up. Had to restart it multiple times until it randomly worked), and they sometimes just disconnect from wifi and have to be restarted. They also don't respond when I talk even if I'm right next to them, but other times they hear me from across the room. The speakers are amazing though; the music quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Amazon rip off
customer_reviews.text: When connecting I used chat feature which connected me to a tech to help setup dot. The tech claimed that my wireless firewall had problems and I needed to purchase a $250 program good for two years in order to make my dot work. $250 to solve a problem I did not even know I had or the dot could not be added to my system. Mine you I already have an Echo 3rd working just fine and no issues with my wireless. $250 for two years to make a $29 dot work. I believe these so called techs are no more then pressure sales to push their software, they have no interest in helping the customer
customer_reviews.author: AR Warren

customer_reviews.title: This is still a beta products and a work in progress
customer_reviews.text: This system takes a tremendous amount of time to set up and integrate with other systems such as ADT and ring and Phillips hue. The integration with ADT security is only I would say at about 80% and still has some bugs that need to be worked out. I would consider the entire Alexa system to be still in the somewhat beta/development stage and I think will someday be a great product but it is still a work in progress especially with its interaction with other peoples applications. The support that you get from Amazon through their device support division is not really that good and the management oversight on it really truly is of poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Imaginative Photography Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth Echo Dot I have purchased, this one replacing a 1st Generation Echo that would no longer connect to music services reliably. The software for this one made set up a breeze, although the Dots are easier to set up than the original Echo devices. The only problem I found with it is that it will not join the network group for music everywhere in my house. Although it is on the same wifi network as the others, it will not connect; the others do, even when not on the same network. Minor frustration, but grouping is supposedly a key feature for the Dots. This one is disappointing only in that area.
customer_reviews.author: LTC LDD

customer_reviews.title: Yay!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is one of my lief's greatest purchases. My little girl is miles and miles away from me, but now my 3 year old just commands her Dot 3 to "Call Mama" and my Alexa gadgets alert me wherever I am that my baby needs me. I cried.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Capabilities, Superb Contruction, 10 Star - a Keeper !
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product delivered super fast. Automatically connected and was ready to work. It is like having a supercomputer. Very pleasant voice recognition, lots of "discoverable" features such as say Alexa Next to play the next song , or "Play more like this". Other features are like asking a real Wizard of Oz - anything you want to know from recipes, current news etc. Physical quality and packaging is perfection. (not tried) can also do the light bulbs on off etc and a much more affordable price than Apple. For those shy of complex and complicated technology I t hink you will enjoy the simplicity of use and capabilities of Echo Dot.
customer_reviews.author: Ice Planet

customer_reviews.title: Best small speaker ever!
customer_reviews.text: My parents have an Echo Dot 2nd generation and were not very happy with it's low volume and audio quality but I decided to order the Echo Dot 3rd generation due to the great bundles deal with Amazon Music Unlimited and I have to say I was so impressed I had to bring it to their house so they could see how amazing the new generation is! The audio quality is far superior to anything else this small and the volume is magnificent. I'd easily pay the retail price to get another so they can enjoy mine.
customer_reviews.author: georgie

customer_reviews.title: So much better sounding than the original Dot
customer_reviews.text: The 3rd Gen dot is far better sounding than the original. I'm really surprised at just how much sound comes out of this little thing. I picked this up along with a battery holder to as a portable. My wife has a daycare and takes it outside with the kids so they have kids music while they play. The original dot is really only useful sound wise for speech unless you use a Bluetooth speaker with it, but this one is plenty good enough on it's own for basic music. It's not as good or room filling as the Echo Plus of course, but it's good for a smaller room or basic non blasting music.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Morgan

customer_reviews.title: ALEXA SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: Alexa sucks! I own both a google and an alexa, alexa was amazing for the first few weeks, after a few she would stop in the middle of a task and say she couldn’t connect to the internet Google home connects to the internet fine, Our phones connect to the internet fine, game systems, tv, ect! they all are connected and work just fine. But alexa doesn’t! I mainly use her to play music and she cannot play a full song without getting disconnected from the internet.
customer_reviews.author: PRINCESS

customer_reviews.title: Cool product but be wary of what your order
customer_reviews.text: This is not a review of the product but of the ordering process. I searched for Echo Dot with Clock and it pulled up. However, I learned only after I got my Echo Dot that only one color has the clock. It frustrated me that 2 color color products were ONLY Kids editions. Then I chose the color I wanted, not realizing that that color does not have the clock. My complaint is to Amazon. If they are different products (Echo Dot 4 color choices, Echo Dot with Clock 1 color choice, and Echo Dot Kids editions 2 color choices) don't have them on the same product page. Or else offer each product in all six color choices.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey H. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Best Echo Dot yet!
customer_reviews.text: This new echo dot has great sound quality, better than my other, older dots. When I access music it is very clear and has more bass quality to it than the older dots. I got the new one to replace my clock radio in my bathroom and I don't miss the radio at all! Also, the interactive quality of this 3rd generation dot is much better as well. It guided me through a clearer voice recognition program. I highly recommend this 3rd generation dot. It was also very easy to install with the Alexa app on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: pianogirl

customer_reviews.title: BEST HELP FOR ELDERLY
customer_reviews.text: Love this. So much more useful than timers. I can turn different lights on/off and even schedule them. I can also control them with my voice or through the app in my phone. I bought my parents these with Echos for Christmas. Because these make lights handsfree, they're perfect for elderly that need their hands for walker stability. They also love being able to use their voices to turn on/off their lights at night. I bought Echo shows to check on my parents too. I can sleep while listening to make sure they're ok after coming home from the hospital. Paired with the Ring doorbell, they can talk and see the nurses and caregivers.
customer_reviews.author: Little One

customer_reviews.title: I expected more
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like that Alexa has no manners. I’ve had Cortana and Siri and both of them, when I say thank you, replied with something like “you’re welcome “ or “anytime “ . Alexa doesn’t reply to “thank you”. also, when I ask her to read one of my kindle books to me, she often gets the wrong book or starts in the middle of the book, or only reads the reviews. When I play music, she doesn’t seem to understand “turn it up” or “turn it down “.
customer_reviews.author: Enola Faith

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with existing 5 Echo network. OK as single unit
customer_reviews.text: Based solely on the experience with this Echo, I'd declare the product a disaster and customer rip off. This addition to a system with 5 Echos is a disaster. It performs individually, but not with the system. I even re-identified all other Echos in our house to create a new connectivity system. It's OK if you want a voice-on-command clock, or radio, or reminder, or reminder about your pet's vet appointment. Otherwise, it is a technological deficiency. Buy one or two, be happy. Don't expect a home-wide reliable system. It's a fish that has been out of water too long.
customer_reviews.author: Foto Gato

customer_reviews.title: A Lot Has Been Written About Alexa
customer_reviews.text: What I like most is that I bought it primarily to allow a handicapped person to phone me by voice from any room in the house (Four Dots, small house) and provide intercom capabilities between rooms. It does all of that very well, but then there is the 'but it also does this' factor. There are just so many capabilities that I did not buy it for but are useful, like playing: music, radio (NPR), news, weather, podcasts, etc. It can spell, answer questions, do reminders and tell a joke. For the price, can't beat it. Even looks good and the Dots are just the right size. They do not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Keith777

customer_reviews.title: I SPYz
customer_reviews.text: First let me say the sound quality is very good . The size is very convenient. NOW, let's get down- I may be paranoid however, I feel this device is NOTHING more than an advertising scheme ( why the low price) to have you BUY BUY BUY BUY perks........I also wonder with the voice recognition - if BIG BROTHER in this case ( AMAZON) is not listening in to everything it can hear......." You decide " I keep mine in a THICK BOX unless it's playing music. The rest of the things Alexa does is just F L U F F ...exciting at first - then - BORING. Save up for a nice small stereo with a CD player.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.  Randy

customer_reviews.title: A quick and easy set up to get it working right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The 3rd gen Echo Dot works well out of the box. Setup was straightforward using the Alexa app for iPhone. Bluetooth connectivity is easy, but I did have some issues connected it to a Win 10 laptop. In fact, I couldn't get my laptop to recognize the Dot. Integration with music services, Spotify, Amazon Music, and internet radio, Tune In, iHeart, etc was easy to set up and it worked well. My disappointment is with the sound quality. For podcasts, talk radio it sounds good but the range for music is more limited than I had hoped, especially with classical music. If sound quality is your biggest concern consider buying a different model.
customer_reviews.author: calabashkid

customer_reviews.title: Getting used to my Alexa world
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning the Skills portion as much as Alexa is and it has been somewhat difficult on the integration of my Alexa enabled devices. It is difficult to remember exactly how to say the skill command when you have several setup and would be a bonus if Alexa was intuitive enough to hear key words in the skill to perform it. Speaker is actually pretty good for the open concept room when playing music. Voice recognition is fairly accurate with having at least four people speaking to it at any given time. Phrasing of command seems to be the key to be successful in returning what you asked for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: Pro: it’s easy to request songs to be played w/Amazon music. Cons: I have to continuously yell at it to do anything. It’s so annoying yelling at it to turn volume up and down, skip song, ext It also doesn’t hear me when music is playing. Also, does a poor job recognizing my voice. Works better with Amazon music.. without it my song request is never available. It keeps syncing to my TV and playing the sound threw the dot, which doesn’t sound good and comes from opposite direction of theTV. I always have to yell for it to un sync. Basically a lot of yelling when I could just use my phone or remote. I never use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a clock radio that was sitting on my bathroom counter. The Dot 3rd Gen is small and will play my radio stations from iHeart Radio or music from Amazon Music. Ask the time or temperature, or ask about my calendar entry for the day and Alexa provides the info (if you allow connectivity to your calendar). Only reason for the four star rating was for the fact that the plug for the Dot is HUGE. You'd think there would be a way the electrical plug (even though the wire is 90 degrees downward) would be smaller. So, one star deduct for that design. Better sound and looks than my Dot 2 version.
customer_reviews.author: KEW824

customer_reviews.title: Useful but Amazon uses it to nag you
customer_reviews.text: It's fairly useful. I like how it lets me know when a package is delivered. However, Amazon thought it was genius idea to ANNOY me with their nagging to rate some recent orders. Amazon, you already spam me with emails to do that. When you throw that into Alexa notifications, it's not useful, it's nagging. UPDATE: I've been informed you can turn off these types of notifications for Alexa. Great. But I'm downgrading to a 1-star for some Amazon rep absolutely spamming my phone number (3 times within 3 minutes!) to tell me this when that could've just been done over email. Yikes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Meets our Needs
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Dot was easy to install. We bought it for the convenience of the intercom feature or the "drop in" way of using Alexa. We have a family room that is located at an inconvenient place to be able to hear well from other rooms in the house. This feature helps us to be able to keep in touch easier. Alexa's bot qualities are fun to access although sometimes either we dont make a clear question that it hears correctly or its receptive sound still needs more upgrade. At any rate we are satisfied and it does what we intended it to do when we decided to buy a Dot.
customer_reviews.author: Milonga

customer_reviews.title: The New Design is more elegant and sounds terrific! All at a great price point!
customer_reviews.text: This new unit is more appealing than the ABS pipe aesthetic appeal of the past and sounds great in our space! The new color palette options allow you to tailor the color to your personality or space. The speakers really sound great and fill the space surprisingly well for the size and form factor of the unit. Anyhow, it’s a great upgrade if you want to bump the hockey pucks of the past out to your shop where you don’t really care what it looks like, or if you just want to have the latest greatest at a reasonable price... Anyhow, Mrs. F. Loved this practical gift this Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Antonius F.

customer_reviews.title: It is a handy device.
customer_reviews.text: The Echo is still a novelty for me. I did, however, get it to work with my Harmony hub after doing some research. However, having a suspicious nature, I manually turn off the microphone before going to bed. I'm partially deaf so the sound seems somewhat muffled even with my hearing aids on. But, I really only wanted to use the Echo to turn my entertainment devices on and off. The Harmony hub now allows me to do that. The only other thing I have problems with is integrating my Arlo cameras with it. It use to work before Echo but not any more. I'm sure Echo can do much more with other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Chappy

customer_reviews.title: Good Speaker
customer_reviews.text: I was a long holdout for the Echo devices, I always thought I didn't need one. Boy was I wrong! They were having a sale, so I picked up two of them and couldn't be any happier. There are so many things I can do now, it even integrates perfectly with my FireTV. It always understands what I'm saying and usually gets it right. The only gripe I have, is the sound quality. I know they improved it, but sometimes it has sound issues if there's too much bass in a song, but this device is more about convenience and not superb audio quality. There are many other Bluetooth speakers that have great sound (and great price).
customer_reviews.author: Jason

product_meta.title: Echo Dot (3rd Gen) - Smart speaker with Alexa - Charcoal
feature_bullets: Meet Echo Dot - Our most popular smart speaker with a fabric design. It is our most compact smart speaker that fits perfectly into small spaces.
Improved speaker quality - Better speaker quality than Echo Dot Gen 2 for richer and louder sound. Pair with a second Echo Dot for stereo sound.
Voice control your music - Stream songs from Amazon Music, Apple Music, Spotify, Sirius XM, and others.
Ready to help - Ask Alexa to play music, answer questions, read the news, check the weather, set alarms, control compatible smart home devices, and more.
Voice control your smart home - Turn on lights, adjust thermostats, lock doors, and more with compatible connected devices. Create routines to start and end your day.
Connect with others - Call almost anyone hands-free. Instantly drop in on other rooms in your home or make an announcement to every room with a compatible Echo device.
Alexa has skills - With tens of thousands of skills and counting, Alexa is always getting smarter and adding new skills like tracking fitness, playing games, and more.
Designed to protect your privacy - Built with multiple layers of privacy protections and controls, including a microphone off button that electronically disconnects the microphones.
